name: Jessica Pressler
build: Build in an AP glass over ice, top with cava, quick stir with a bar spoon.
radioByte: Named for the American Journalist whom famously wrote about the dancers at Scores (which turned into the movie Hustlers) and The Soho Grifter - Anna Delvey (which turned into Inventing Anna the limited series). This is a refreshing spritz with an adorable flower garnish.

name: 6PM in Osaka
build: Shake first 4 ingredients, build in a highball with ice and soda, strain and top with grenadine.
radioByte: This is a refreshing highball with a passion fruit and grenadine float.

name: Beekman Vesper
build: Jigger 3oz of batch into a mixing glass, stir, serve up in a nick & nora, garnished with lemon twist and olive flag.
radioByte: Vespers are traditionally an equal split base stirred martini with dry vermouth, in this case we replace the vermouth with the Italicus Bergamot liqueur which is a citrus liqueur.

name: Pablo Neruda
build: Build in tin. Long Shake. Strain over fresh ice. Garnish with black salt rim and dehydrated lime.
radioByte: Chilean Poet. This is a spicy margarita with a black salt rim.

name: Rosario Candella
build: Stir and strain over big rock
radioByte: Sicilian-American architect known for his Park Avenue apartment designs.

name: Hayao Miyazaki
build: Build in a tin, LONG shake, strain into a coupe.
radioByte: Aquafaba is the liquid that comes from chickpeas, it is used in the same way we use egg whites to create a Sour cocktail with a perfect foam. Tincture is essentially a uber strong tea made with high proof alcohol. Raspberry 2 ways - in a liqueur and also a seasonal market berry syrup. Fat-washing is a process used to infuse flavors from oils/fats onto spirits without taking on the fatty/oily properties. Essentially this is a grown-up PBJ 'sour' with a matcha garnish
